answers.answer: These are a collection of non-specific symptoms that can be caused by a variety of conditions.The neurological issues like fatigue, headache, and numbness can be evaluated with an MRI as well as nerve conduction studies to rule out many of the major neurological disorders.Irregular heartbeats can be evaluated via an echocardiogram as well as Holter monitor.The pain under the right rib can be due to a variety of GI causes (which can be evaluated with an ultrasound or CT scan) as well as pulmonary issues.  If negative, musculoskeletal injury can be considered.I would consider a neurology referral at this point.These options can be discussed with your personal physician.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.kevinmd_

Tanya, many of those symptoms sound like fibromyalgia and you have said that you have this.  Fibromyalgia can flare up bad, and at points you will feel like you have energy but be careful because it is deceiving and you will end up feeling way worse if you "over-exert".Also you may look into if you are a celiac (allergic to wheat...) or if you have excessive candida in your gut, as both of these can cause many of your symptoms and I have read that there may be a link between these and Fibro or CFS.
get your blood sugar checked as well. Have you been checked for diabetes?
